Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] performance question!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=269199031

Take a look at your frontier report early in crawling and then later in 
the crawl.  I expect that you will probably find that late in the crawl 
there are relatively few active queues -- All the hosts which had 
relatively few URIs to crawl were exhausted earlier in the crawl -- now 
you're seeing the small number of hosts which have a large number of 
documents.

(In some cases, this could be crawler traps, such as hosts which 
generate an infinite number of URLs, either through session ID 
parameters or other dynamically generated content, such as calendars.)

Mike

vretr wrote:

> slowly, and the speed is usually lower than 5kb/sec, and few of
> ToeThread is in active state. What causes this problem? Is there
> something wrong with the software, hardware or crawling goals? How to
> solve the problems?
> 
> thanks
